newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU to block Italian aid to SGS-Thomson.
newsitem.headline: EU to block Italian aid to SGS-Thomson.

text.p: The European Commission is expected to block a proposal by Italy to grant 18 million European currency units ($20.3 million) in aid to semiconductor producer SGS-Thomson at its next weekly meeting on Thursday.
EU sources said European Competition Commissioner Karel Van Miert had proposed banning the grant on the grounds that it did not fall under EU rules allowing aid for research and development projects.
But European Research Commissioner Edith Cresson disagreed and won a 'tactical' delay of one week, they said, adding that the decision would go through next week.
Italy proposed helping SGS-Thomson finance the cost of designing and developing integrated circuits for computer and other applications. The 18 million ecus have not been paid yet.
Van Miert's services have concluded that the aid was not needed as the research work had already been largely successfully accomplished, the sources said. The research programme began in 1993.
SGS-Thomson is a joint venture between Italian industrial state holding IRI and France's Thomson SA, each with a 35-percent stake. The remaining shares are on the market. $1 = 0.884
